content: The H3L ligand (0.15 mmol, 30.1 mg) was dissolved in 10 mL methanol, then samarium benzoate (0.3 mmol, 157.8 mg) was added under continuously stirring at room temperature. After that, 5 mL tetrahydrofuran (THF) was added and the reaction mixture was left unperturbed to allow the slow evaporation of the solvent. Pale white single crystals, suitable for X-ray diffraction analysis, were obtained after five days. Yield: 29.8 mg (17%, based on the metal). Elemental analysis (%) calcd for 1: C 47.81, H 4.01; found C 47.60, H 3.88.
clean_text: The H3L ligand (0.15 mmol, 30.1 mg) was dissolved in 10 mL methanol, then samarium benzoate (0.3 mmol, 157.8 mg) was added under continuously stirring at room temperature. After that, 5 mL tetrahydrofuran (THF) was added and the reaction mixture was left unperturbed to allow the slow evaporation of the solvent. Pale white single crystals, suitable for X-ray diffraction analysis, were obtained after five days. Yield: 29.8 mg (17%, based on the metal). Elemental analysis (%) calcd for 1: C 47.81, H 4.01; found C 47.60, H 3.88.
